meanings.definition: A place where food is prepared and sold.
meanings.sent1: I visited the cookshops to buy some delicious pastries.
meanings.sent2: My mom loves to buy fresh bread from the cookshops every morning.
meanings.sent3: The cookshops were so busy that the chefs started doing cartwheels to entertain the customers.
meanings.sent4: The cookshops in the market were a colorful array of tempting aromas and flavors.
meanings.sent5: The cookshops on the street corner always lured me in with their mouthwatering treats.

meanings.definition: A store that sells cooking supplies.
meanings.sent1: I need to visit the cookshops to buy a new set of knives for my kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The cookshops in town have a wide selection of pots and pans.
meanings.sent3: The cookshops had a sale on spatulas, so I bought one in every color!
meanings.sent4: The cookshops were a treasure trove of culinary tools waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: Walking into the cookshops felt like stepping into a wonderland of kitchen gadgets.
